baselineFeatures.comment: Places an element based on the position of another element. Useful with popover.
Applies graphical effects such as blurring or color shifting to the area behind an element. Useful with modal windows.
Applies styles based on the size of a container rather than the viewport. Useful for responsive component design.
The ::details-content pseudo-element selects the expandable content of a <details> element, excluding the <summary>.
Represents a modal or non-modal dialog box, such as a confirmation prompt or a subwindow used to enter data.
Matches an element containing a slot that has assigned nodes matching the specified selector.
Matches any element that can be selected by one of the selectors in that list.
Matches an element containing a slot that has assigned nodes matching the specified selector.
Enable animation and transition interpolation between a numeric value and a keyword value, such as from a fixed length to auto or fit-content.
Matches any element that can be selected by one of the selectors in that list.
Sets how far overflow content may appear outside the bounds of an element. Useful when focus outline is hidden by overflow: hidden.
Creates an overlay to display content on top of other page content.
For aligning nested grid items with the parent grid.
View transitions allow you to create animated visual transitions between different states of a document.

bcdFeatures.comment: Encapsulation using # prefix for class fields.
Ergonomic brand checks for private fields.
Encapsulation using # prefix for class methods.
